main event: On 6 April 1952, an unidentified flying object was observed in Dallas, Texas, described as a bright metallic sphere or disc.
interesting points: The object was first seen at an azimuth of approximately 190 degrees and elevation of 30 degrees., The observation lasted for about 30 seconds before the object moved rapidly in a northerly direction., There were multiple reports related to the sighting on 6 April 1952., The observers included Major M, who is considered a reliable source., Weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a bright metallic sphere or disc
witness description: civilian and military observers, including Boy Scouts and Major M
